pageContext.claim: “If you look at our number when we first got in, we were hitting one-percent numbers and nobody even talks about it.  Well, last quarter, we hit 3 percent GDP.”
pageContext.analysis: GDP growth was 3.6 percent in the third quarter of 2016, so there is nothing amazing or shocking about 3 percent. Trump during the campaign pledged to achieve 4 percent annual growth, which most economists said was unrealistic. Since he took office, the president misleadingly has said he pledged three percent growth.
